1st Degree Child Sex Assault-Contact w/Person under 16-Use/Threat of Force/Violence (Actor is 18)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul G Davidson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault AMENDED FROM 1st Degree Child Sex Assault-Contact w/Person under 16, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution must be paid during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

CORRECTED 04-22-2016 to correct resitution amount.

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must have sex offender assessment within 30 days, register with the Sex Offender Registry Program and follow all rules of same. May have contact with daughter as long as defendant has not had any alcohol to drink. For the first year of probation, defendant must attend 5 self-help groups a week and submit proof of attendance to agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact with the victim or her family unless they request it and agent approves. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes: Huber is granted for employment and counseling. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety is required.   AMENDED 10-12-2016:  Court hereby orders that the conditional jail time sentence be reduced by 19 days for 462 hours of community service that the defendant has performed.

Defendant Paul G Davidson in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Arraignment scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Atty Patrick Cafferty
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No contact with any minor children.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.    Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
